note.text: You probably wonâ€™t be using an interpreter if you are working with English-speaking counterparts. However, if you do have an interpreter, it can be a good idea to use them as a cultural adviser.

Try to choose an interpreter who is older, particularly for civilian interactions. A young interpreter may not be willing to speak to your counterparts in a direct manner. To build rapport more easily, it can also be helpful to use an interpreter who is from the region where you are interacting with locals.
You can find more information in the Working with Interpreters lesson.
